title: The VIKING WARRIOR
body_text:
EVENT BACKGROUND
The date and time of the soon-to-be named WARRIORS was officially announced at ANNIVERSARY 6 in September. The two weeks leading up to event spawned tremendous curiosity as "one of the biggest surprises in
ECD
history" was to set be unveiled.
Only few clues were offered as WARRIORS approached, the primary being the vague, almost-ominous background of the official promotional poster.
SURPRISE, SURPRISE
The wonder and mystery surrounding WARRIORS culminated in the long-awaited return of the legendary catching machine,
Michael "Sputz" Krott
. Since April 2011, the charter member of the
ECDElite
has been studying at the Motorcycle Mechanics Institute in Orlando, Florida.
Upon his celebrated return to the Wall High School tennis courts, he was granted creative control over WARRIORS - an event name selected by the icon himself - a responsibility that included the formation of teams and addition of stipulations.
MAIN MATCH
WARRIORS was well-received by most participating dodgeballers largely in part to the high level of comedy and lack of fierce competition. "Sputz's" incorporation of Prison Ball, a rarity in the back portion of the tennis courts, was also a hit among attendees.
Additionally, the competing squads featured a collection of past and present combatants from all different eras of
East Coast Dodgeball
. The first lineup saw the likes of Dan Spengeman '05, Lauren Stopa '05, Melissa Kerr '06, Juan Londono '07, Jason Teiltelbaum '07, Jon Yochum '08, and the reemerging "Sputz". Their adversaries consisted of John Tronolone '05, Diana DiBuccio '05, Kevin Megill '05, Pam D'Luhy '07, Michelle Mullins '07, Joanice Lima '10, and Rob Knott '11.
ECDElitist
Justin Pierce '05 also made a late-evening appearance, aiding both teams for one game each.
In all, 13 rounds were contested, 9 of which captured by the Sputz-led coalition.
Online Exclusive!
"It's amazing that only a 15-person match can make someone happier than they have been in a long time." - Michael "Sputz" Krott
FOLLOW-UP NOTES
The attendance of fifteen (15) consisted of 9 men and 6 women. No new players were recorded.
WARRIORS became the first Tronolone-produced extravaganza, the 8th overall, to feature 13 total games [or more] since DODGEBALL 79 in March 2007.
Notable spectators included Katie Grand, Logan Teiltelbaum, and Lexi D'Luhy.
WARRIORS took place on the six year anniversary of the first-ever "Wet War", DODGEBALL VII. The memorable 2005 event also comprised a turnout of 15.
NEXT EVENT
Billed as "2011's Finale Event",
East Coast Dodgeball
proudly presents
FINAL DESTINATION
, coming in November. Check back in the coming week for more information.
body_html:
• EVENT BACKGROUND
    The date and time of the soon-to-be named WARRIORS was officially announced at ANNIVERSARY 6 in September. The two weeks leading up to event spawned tremendous curiosity as "one of the biggest surprises in ECD history" was to set be unveiled.

    Only few clues were offered as WARRIORS approached, the primary being the vague, almost-ominous background of the official promotional poster.

  • SURPRISE, SURPRISE
    The wonder and mystery surrounding WARRIORS culminated in the long-awaited return of the legendary catching machine, Michael "Sputz" Krott. Since April 2011, the charter member of the ECDElite has been studying at the Motorcycle Mechanics Institute in Orlando, Florida.

    Upon his celebrated return to the Wall High School tennis courts, he was granted creative control over WARRIORS - an event name selected by the icon himself - a responsibility that included the formation of teams and addition of stipulations.

  • MAIN MATCH
    WARRIORS was well-received by most participating dodgeballers largely in part to the high level of comedy and lack of fierce competition. "Sputz's" incorporation of Prison Ball, a rarity in the back portion of the tennis courts, was also a hit among attendees.

    Additionally, the competing squads featured a collection of past and present combatants from all different eras of East Coast Dodgeball. The first lineup saw the likes of Dan Spengeman '05, Lauren Stopa '05, Melissa Kerr '06, Juan Londono '07, Jason Teiltelbaum '07, Jon Yochum '08, and the reemerging "Sputz". Their adversaries consisted of John Tronolone '05, Diana DiBuccio '05, Kevin Megill '05, Pam D'Luhy '07, Michelle Mullins '07, Joanice Lima '10, and Rob Knott '11. ECDElitist Justin Pierce '05 also made a late-evening appearance, aiding both teams for one game each.

    In all, 13 rounds were contested, 9 of which captured by the Sputz-led coalition.

    Online Exclusive!
    "It's amazing that only a 15-person match can make someone happier than they have been in a long time." - Michael "Sputz" Krott

  • FOLLOW-UP NOTES
    The attendance of fifteen (15) consisted of 9 men and 6 women. No new players were recorded.

    WARRIORS became the first Tronolone-produced extravaganza, the 8th overall, to feature 13 total games [or more] since DODGEBALL 79 in March 2007.

    Notable spectators included Katie Grand, Logan Teiltelbaum, and Lexi D'Luhy.

    WARRIORS took place on the six year anniversary of the first-ever "Wet War", DODGEBALL VII. The memorable 2005 event also comprised a turnout of 15.

  • NEXT EVENT
    Billed as "2011's Finale Event", East Coast Dodgeball proudly presents FINAL DESTINATION, coming in November. Check back in the coming week for more information.
